Welcome to JDO_V-V’s documentation!¶

Validation and Verification for FastQC files generated through the RNASeq pipeline.

VV.fastqc.validate_verify(samples, input_path, paired_end, expected_suffix)¶

Checks fastqc files match what is expected given a set of samples.

Parameters

  • samples ([<class 'str'>]) – sample names, should be extracted from ISA file

  • input_path (str) – directory containing output from fastQC

  • paired_end (bool) – True if paired end, False if single end reads

  • expected_suffix (str) – Added by fastQC (e.g. ‘_raw_fastqc’)

VV.multiqc.validate_verify(multiQC_zip_path, paired_end, sequence_length_tolerance=0.05)¶

Checks multiQC data to ensure a metrics about raw reads are reasonable.

Logs an error if the average sequence length of any sample significantly different than the rest of the data.

Parameters

  • multiQC_zip_path (str) – path to multiQC zip file

  • paired_end (bool) – True for assessing paired end reads, False for single end

  • sequence_length_tolerance (float) – Percent allowed smaller or greater than the median before error is logged

VV.parse_isa.get_sample_names(isa_zip_path)¶

Extracts investigation sample names given a GLDS isa zip file path. Returns a dictionary

Parameters

isa_zip_path (str) – path to isa zip file

Return type

None

VV.parse_isa.parse_isa_dir_from_zip(isa_zip_path, pretty_print=False)¶

Unzips ISA zip files as found in GLDS metadata folders.

ISA record metadata signature should match the specs here: https://isa-specs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/isamodel.html

Parameters

  • isa_zip_path (str) – path to isa zip file

  • pretty_print (bool) – print contents of parsed file, useful for debugging

Return type

ISATabRecord

V-V for raw reads.

class VV.raw_reads.rawReadsInfo(sample_names)¶
property sample_names¶

Alias for field number 0

VV.raw_reads.validate_verify(input_path, paired_end, check_lines, md5sums={})¶

Performs validation and verification for input of RNASeq datasets. Additionally checks for FastQC file existence.

This assumes the following file format:

Mmus_BAL-TAL_LRTN_FLT_Rep5_F10_R2_raw.fastq.gz
<SAMPLE NAME-----------------><READ->.fastq.gz

This also assumes that regardless of paired or single mode, there exists a file named:

<SAMPLE NAME>_R1_raw.fastq.gz and <SAMPLE NAME> never includes “_R1_raw.fastq.gz”

Performs the following checks: #. File name enumeration #. Sample name extraction #. Checks for appropriate number of raw read files (2x samples for Paired, 1x samples for Single) #. Check every identifier lines appear every four lines as expect TODO: parse identifier lines for UMI #. md5sum check (if expected md5sums are supplied) #. FastQC file count check #. File Size stats

Parameters

  • input_path (str) – path where the raw read files are location

  • paired_end (bool) – True for paired end, False for single reads

  • md5sums (dict) – dictionary of raw read file to md5sum, e.g. Mmus_BAL-TAL_LRTN_BSL_Rep1_B7_R1_raw.fastq.gz : b21ca61d56208d49b9422a1306d0a0f1

  • check_lines (bool) – checks identifier lines if True, takes around 10 min per file with GLDS-194
